Issues.Title: fix(platform-server): avoid duplicate TransferState info after renderApplication call
Issues.Body:
This commit updates the `renderApplication` function to avoid duplicate serialization of the data from the `TransferState` class. The `renderApplication` function imports providers from the `ServerModule`, which already include the `TransferState` serialization providers, but the same providers were also included inside the `renderApplication` as well, which led to the duplication.

Issues.Title: router: `The ActivatedRoute has an invalid structure` warning improvements
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

router

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

#47988 introduced a warning in dev when the ActivatedRoute has an invalid structure

This ends up generating quite a lot of noise when updating existing tests as the warning is outputted several times per test.

For example, consider this small repro https://stackblitz.com/edit/node-1bky4j?file=repro/src/app/home/home.component.spec.ts (run `ng test`)

The template has just a `routerLink`, and the test provides a "fake" ActivatedRoute (usually with params, but the point is that it's partial and thus incomplete).

This ends up generating:

```
âœ” Browser application bundle generation complete.
WARN: 'The ActivatedRoute has an invalid structure. This is likely due to an incomplete mock in tests.'
Firefox 109.0 (Mac OS 10.15): Executed 2 of 5 SUCCESS (0 secs / 0.03 secs)
WARN: 'The ActivatedRoute has an invalid structure. This is likely due to an incomplete mock in 
WARN: 'The ActivatedRoute has an invalid structure. This is likely due to an incomplete mock in tests.'
Firefox 109.0 (Mac OS 10.15): Executed 2 of 5 SUCCESS (0 secs / 0.03 secs)
WARN: 'The ActivatedRoute has an invalid structure. This is likely due to an incomplete mock in 
WARN: 'The ActivatedRoute has an invalid structure. This is likely due to an incomplete mock in tests.'
Firefox 109.0 (Mac OS 10.15): Executed 3 of 5 SUCCESS (0 secs / 0.045 secs)
WARN: 'The ActivatedRoute has an invalid structure. This is likely due to an incomplete mock in 
WARN: 'The ActivatedRoute has an invalid structure. This is likely due to an incomplete mock in tests.'
Firefox 109.0 (Mac OS 10.15): Executed 3 of 5 SUCCESS (0 secs / 0.045 secs)
WARN: 'The ActivatedRoute has an invalid structure. This is likely due to an incomplete mock in 
WARN: 'The ActivatedRoute has an invalid structure. This is likely due to an incomplete mock in tests.'
Firefox 109.0 (Mac OS 10.15): Executed 4 of 5 SUCCESS (0 secs / 0.05 secs)
WARN: 'The ActivatedRoute has an invalid structure. This is likely due to an incomplete mock in 
WARN: 'The ActivatedRoute has an invalid structure. This is likely due to an incomplete mock in tests.'
Firefox 109.0 (Mac OS 10.15): Executed 4 of 5 SUCCESS (0 secs / 0.05 secs)
WARN: 'The ActivatedRoute has an invalid structure. This is likely due to an incomplete mock in 
Firefox 109.0 (Mac OS 10.15): Executed 5 of 5 SUCCESS (0.086 secs / 0.054 secs)
```

A few questions:
- is the warning really necessary in that case? It's hard to understand (from the warning alone, and even after looking at #47988) in what way this is an issue
- if the warning is necessary and something needs to be fixed for an upcoming change, maybe the warning could include a bit more information on how to do so? I suppose that most developers that are going to run into it will ask the same question. I'll gladly submit a PR to improve it if I get some guidance on what would need to be changed
- if the warning is necessary, could it be displayed less often? because it is outputted dozens of times on some applications where I tested the RC

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://stackblitz.com/edit/node-1bky4j?file=repro/src/app

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

_No response_

### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular CLI: 15.2.0-rc.0
Node: 16.17.0
Package Manager: yarn 1.22.17
OS: darwin arm64

Angular: 15.2.0-rc.0
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... localize, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1502.0-rc.0
@angular-devkit/build-angular   15.2.0-rc.0
@angular-devkit/core            15.2.0-rc.0
@angular-devkit/schematics      15.2.0-rc.0
@angular/cdk                    15.1.4
@schematics/angular             15.2.0-rc.0
rxjs                            7.8.0
typescript                      4.8.4
```

_No response_

Issues.Title: refactor(router): Remove warning for an invalid ActivatedRoute
Issues.Body:
This warning was put in place to surface an error when developers use an ActivatedRoute with an invalid structure in tests. However, there isn't a clear path to fixing it and the tests continue to pass (ideally - that's what the recovery code is there for). Rather than surfacing an error that developers would be confused by and likely ignore, it would be better to not warn at all unless there is a clearer action to take to resolve the issue.

resolves #49116
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "refactor(router): Remove warning for an invalid ActivatedRoute" (#49117)

Issues.Title: build: avoid unnecessary re-evaluation of starlark code
Issues.Body:
The experimental allow tags propagation flag is a `BuildLanguage` option and causes all Starlark
code to be re-invoked. This causes a slow-down when switching between bazel query/ bazel
build because the option is not set for `bazel query`.

We fix it by applying the option to all commands, using `common`.

Issues.Title: Typed Forms: Unable to use formBuilder.array() for a typed form array with empty initialization
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

forms

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

I'm unable to initialize a (pre) typed form with an empty form array, because the formArray type cannot be inferred with an empty initialization.

form type
```
interface EntryForm {
  title: FormControl<string>;
  entries: FormArray<
    FormGroup<{
      entryId: FormControl<string>;
    }>
  >;
}
```

not working (type error)
```
  formA = this.fb.nonNullable.group<EntryForm>({
    title: this.fb.nonNullable.control(''),
    entries: this.fb.nonNullable.array([]),
  });
```

working example
```
  formB = this.fb.nonNullable.group<EntryForm>({
    title: this.fb.nonNullable.control(''),
    entries: this.fb.nonNullable.array([
      this.fb.nonNullable.group({
        entryId: this.fb.nonNullable.control(''),
      }),
    ]),
  });
```

workaround - cast the form array to any
```
  formC = this.fb.nonNullable.group<EntryForm>({
    title: this.fb.nonNullable.control(''),
    entries: this.fb.nonNullable.array([]) as any,
  });
```

I provided a stackblitz example to showcase this issue.

Is this intentional or are there other ways to initialize an empty typed form array?

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-pbt1ra?file=src/main.ts

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
Type 'FormArray<FormControl<unknown>>' is not assignable to type 'FormArray<FormGroup<{ entryId: FormControl<string>; }>>'.
  Types of property 'controls' are incompatible.
    Type 'FormControl<unknown>[]' is not assignable to type 'FormGroup<{ entryId: FormControl<string>; }>[]'.
      Type 'FormControl<unknown>' is not assignable to type 'FormGroup<{ entryId: FormControl<string>; }>'
```


### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
"dependencies": {
  "@angular/animations": "^15.1.2",
  "@angular/common": "^15.1.2",
  "@angular/compiler": "^15.1.2",
  "@angular/core": "^15.1.2",
```

Issues.Title: While testing with Jest 29, zone.js prints an Unhandled Promise rejection using firstValueFrom
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

zone.js

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

I use Jest for the app testing.

After updating Jest 28 to 29 I found this issue: 

I have this function on the app component: 

```
public async testFunction() {
    await firstValueFrom(of('').pipe(
      map(() => {
        throw 'error'
      })
    ))
  }
```

and I have this test on the spec file: 

```
it('should throw an error', async () => {
    const fixture = TestBed.createComponent(AppComponent);
    const app = fixture.componentInstance;
    try {
      await app.testFunction();
    } catch (e) {
      expect(true).toEqual(true);
    }
  });
```
Using Jest 28 it works perfect, but If I update to Jest 29 Zone.js prints a console.error like the promise was unhandled but as you can see on the test I handle the promise.

The test passes, but the console.error is annoying.

Please, read the anything else part to see my jest configuration. To compare between Jest versions you can execute: 

`npm uninstall jest jest-preset-angular @types/jest`
Jest 29 try: `npm install --save-dev jest jest-preset-angular@next @types/jest`
Jest 28 try: `npm install --save-dev jest jest-preset-angular @types/jest`

Thanks!




### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

[example-project](https://github.com/jordibaliellas/angular-jest-29)

```true
console.error
    Unhandled Promise rejection: error ; Zone: ProxyZone ; Task: null ; Value: error undefined

      at Object.api.onUnhandledError (node_modules/zone.js/bundles/zone-testing-bundle.umd.js:1109:29)
      at handleUnhandledRejection (node_modules/zone.js/bundles/zone-testing-bundle.umd.js:1137:17)
      at _loop_2 (node_modules/zone.js/bundles/zone-testing-bundle.umd.js:1128:21)
      at Object.api.microtaskDrainDone (node_modules/zone.js/bundles/zone-testing-bundle.umd.js:1132:17)
      at drainMicroTaskQueue (node_modules/zone.js/bundles/zone-testing-bundle.umd.js:639:22)
```

Issues.Title: ContentChildren decorator with static flag
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

core

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

The documentation and the type declaration for `ContentChild` states that the `static` flag is not supported. Therefore, writing the following code `@ContentChildren(ChildCmp, { static: true }) childCmps! : QueryList<ChildCmp>;`, will throw an error and the application will not be compiled.

However, if we bypass the error using `//@ts-ignore` and compile the application, the flag `static` does it's job. 

```ts
ngOnInit() {
    console.log(this.childCmps); // static flag works, and childCmps will include the QueryList
  }
```

Looking at the type definition we see 

```ts
/**
 * Type of the ContentChildren metadata.
 *
 *
 * @Annotation
 * @publicApi
 */
export declare type ContentChildren = Query;

/**
 * ContentChildren decorator and metadata.
 *
 *
 * @Annotation
 * @publicApi
 */
export declare const ContentChildren: ContentChildrenDecorator;
```

On one hand `ContentChildrenDecorator` doesn't include the `static` flag, but the type for the `ContentChildren` is `Query`, which includes this option.

Is there a mistake with the data types because the `static` flag actually works?

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-s7xwpq?file=src/main.ts

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

_No response_

### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
@angular/core: 15.5.1
```


### Anything else?

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "ContentChildren decorator with static flag" (#49105)

Issues.Title: Refused to apply inline style  while nonce is available in the Content Security Policy header
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

Don't known / other

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

Line 83 of the file layout.mjs which is part of the Angular CDK throws the following error:

`
Refused to apply inline style because it violates the following Content Security Policy directive: "style-src 'self' 'nonce-EinOpauVzQr0n6wq5ptWvkI/' fonts.googleapis.com". Either the 'unsafe-inline' keyword, a hash ('sha256-47DEQpj8HBSa+/TImW+5JCeuQeRkm5NMpJWZG3hSuFU='), or a nonce ('nonce-...') is required to enable inline execution.
`

As you see a nonce is available and layout.mjs still refuses to apply the in inline style.

I have created a separate project to reproduce this issue. It is a .NET Framework 4.8 MVC application with Angular 15 embedded in it. The MVC application creates the nonce and it is retrieved in the Angular SPA by following the workaround in this comment https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/6361#issuecomment-860180755


### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://github.com/amanplans/csp-header

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
Refused to apply inline style because it violates the following Content Security Policy directive: "style-src 'self' 'nonce-EinOpauVzQr0n6wq5ptWvkI/' fonts.googleapis.com". Either the 'unsafe-inline' keyword, a hash ('sha256-47DEQpj8HBSa+/TImW+5JCeuQeRkm5NMpJWZG3hSuFU='), or a nonce ('nonce-...') is required to enable inline execution.
```

Issues.Title: Angular 15 breaks browser extensions that rely on __ngContext__ to access view data
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

core

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

PR [#45051](https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/45051) removes access to `LView`s through accessing an Angular's element `__ngContext__` property through the DOM. The only way for browser extensions to interact with Angular apps' data flow, was to iterate through the component's properties through the `__ngContext__` object, as Chrome extensions run in `production mode` ([source](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/40809192/calling-angular2-component-methods-from-console-in-production-mode)).

It looks like Angular 15 removes access to these `LView`'s, replacing them with a unique ID, yet the mapped list of these `LView`s does not seem to be accessible by browser extensions in `prod` mode, effictively breaking them.

Solution could be to expose the list of `LView`s, through a window object or function, so these extensions can fetch the numeric ID from the __ngContext__ property and then accessing their reference in the mapped list.

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

javascript:console.log(getAllAngularRootElements()[0].__ngContext__);//now returning 0 instead of actual data

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
N/A, it returns a numberic ID instead of the data needed for these extensions to function, and there does not seem to be any workaround.
```


### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular: 15.1.4
Browser: Chrome
```


### Anything else?

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Angular 15 breaks browser extensions that rely on __ngContext__ to access view data" (#49102)

Issues.Title: CSS styles not applied if using attribute HostBinding and styling a DIV with the direct child selector in a production build
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug? Don't known / other ### Is this a regression? Yes ### Description If using attribute HostBinding and styling a DIV element with the direct child selector, the styles are not applied. **This happens only in a producton build.** Reproduction: **app.component.html** ```html
Example 1 (css: > div)
Example 2 (css: div)
Example 3 (css: > section)
Example 4 (css: section)
``` **app.component.ts** ```ts import {Component, HostBinding} from '@angular/core'; @Component({ selector: 'app-root', templateUrl: './app.component.html', styleUrls: ['./app.component.scss'], }) export class AppComponent { @HostBinding('attr.data-foo') public foo = 'bar'; } ``` **app.component.scss** ```scss :host { &[data-foo="bar"] { > div.example-1 { background-color: cyan; // not working } div.example-2 { background-color: yellow; // working } > section.example-3 { background-color: red; // working } section.example-4 { background-color: green; // working } } } ``` ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25194435/219303791-d5c2f267-f9c7-4809-a0ff-d3cd9e850870.png) In the transpiled CSS we noticed various issues: Example 1: - "nghost" attribute is missing after the attribute selector _[data-foo=bar]_ - "nghost" attribute after _div.example-1_ should instead be "ngcontent" Example 2: - "ngcontent" attribute is missing after _div.example-2_. **IMPORTANT! This is not the cause of this problem, but causes the styles to leak into child components. Please let me know if I should file a separate issue for this case.** ![transpiled css](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25194435/219305802-0dfe5085-c5a3-4268-b243-45913c72bc85.png) ### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug https://github.com/Marcarrian/angular-15-attribute-host-binding-issue ### Please provide the exception or error you saw _No response_ ### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`) ```true Angular CLI: 15.1.5 Node: 16.16.0 Package Manager: npm 8.11.0 OS: win32 x64 Angular: 15.1.4 ... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms ... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router Package Version --------------------------------------------------------- @angular-devkit/architect 0.1501.5 @angular-devkit/build-angular 15.1.5 @angular-devkit/core 15.1.5 @angular-devkit/schematics 15.1.5 @angular/cli 15.1.5 @schematics/angular 15.1.5 rxjs 7.8.0 typescript 4.9.5 ``` ### Anything else? _No response_

Issues.Title: Introduce addControls and removeControls to reactive forms
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

forms

### Description

Currently the only way to add or remove multiple controls or clear all controls from form group is through iterating. In #12747 the issue was closed due to being only a convenient way to do the same with forEach.
This issue is regarding performance. In the case of formRecord when having A LOT of form group entries doing forEach is extremely costly as each operation does quite a bit. 
Those new operations will allow lightweight execution as the heavy stuff will happen once.
I can provide a performance screenshot to prove my point.

### Proposed solution

Add new **performant** functions to reactive forms (especially for form record):
addControls
removeControls
clearControls

### Alternatives considered

Currently the performance on 1000 additions or so is horrible. So either live with it or change to a simple object with form controls inside and handle everything related to the group manually which is horrible too.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Introduce addControls and removeControls to reactive forms" (#49098)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): allow empty scripts to be optimized
Issues.Body:
When using the internal JavaScript optimizer plugin for Webpack with an empty script file provided via the `scripts` option, the build would fail. This was because of a safety check that was checking whether the terser result was falsy. Since an empty string is considered falsy, the build considered the result to be an error. The safety check now will only trigger if the terser result is not a string value to avoid this case.

Fixes #24736
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): allow empty scripts to be optimized" (#24737)

Issues.Title: build: update output target to ES2020
Issues.Body: The minimum supported Node.js version is now v16.13. This version provides full support for ES2020 allowing the output code target to be increased. While Node.js v16.13 supports higher ECMAScript versions, a limitation of the bazel `ts_library` rule currently prevents increasing further at this time.

Issues.Title: build: avoid unnecessary re-evaluation of starlark code
Issues.Body:
The experimental allow tags propagation flag is a `BuildLanguage` option and causes all Starlark code to be re-invoked. This causes a slow-down when switching between bazel query/ bazel build because the option is not set for `bazel query`.

We fix it by applying the option to all commands, using `common`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: avoid unnecessary re-evaluation of starlark code" (#24734)

Issues.Title: Can you add a base-path parameter with ng generate command
Issues.Body:
### Command

generate

### Description

When I build angular library with Secondary Entry Points in a sample layout as below:
```
my_package 
â”œâ”€â”€ src
|   â”œâ”€â”€ public_api.ts
|   â””â”€â”€ *.ts
â”œâ”€â”€ ng-package.json
â”œâ”€â”€ package.json
â””â”€â”€ testing
    â”œâ”€â”€ src
    |   â”œâ”€â”€ public_api.ts
    |   â””â”€â”€ *.ts
    â””â”€â”€ ng-package.json
```

I need to use `ng g` command under main entry point and Secondary Entry Points. But the command just works with "src\lib" as base path. 

### Describe the solution you'd like

Could you provide "base-path" parameter with `ng g` command.   

### Describe alternatives you've considered

_No response_

Issues.Title: refactor(@ngtools/webpack): remove NGCC integration
Issues.Body:
This commit removes usage of NGCC which was used to convert old View Engine libraries to Ivy.

BREAKING CHANGE: NGCC integration has been removed and as a result Angular View Engine libraries will no longer work.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "refactor(@ngtools/webpack): remove NGCC integration" (#24720)

Issues.Title: feat(@angular-devkit/core): update SchemaRegistry `compile` to return `Promise`
Issues.Body:
Use promise based methods to reduce RXJS usage and boiler-platting.

BREAKING CHANGE: Several changes to the `SchemaRegistry`.
- `compile` method now returns a `Promise`.
- Deprecated `flatten` has been removed without replacement.

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/verdaccio/verdaccio/compare/v5.20.1...v5.21.0)

One more step to Verdaccio 5 migration to v6 silently, refactored and better tested modules replace internals without migration required, the idea is help move to verdaccio 6 smoothly as possible without users do much in the near future. You are already using v6 ðŸ˜‰ or parts of it.

Noticeable improvements:

-   Update logger library Pinojs 6 -> 7
-   Internals HTML render engine, same as v6 improved
-   Express.js middlewares improved
-   The first plugin migrated `verdaccio-audit` improved, not longer use `request` and refactored from v6

Some dependencies are limited due verdaccio@5 still supports Node.js 12 (but probably not many users are actually using it and is not recommended)

Issues.Title: tree shaking isn't working properly
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

compiler

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

add a simple import for an injection token increased the package size from `230.96 KB` to `269.82 kB`

the injection token is defined here 
https://github.com/jfcere/ngx-markdown/blob/master/lib/src/markdown.service.ts#L55

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://github.com/robertIsaac/ng-tree-shake/commit/3efc6321ded6d19b3318c0d9cd535d768af9fe61

### Please provide the exception or error you saw
new project
```
Initial Chunk Files           | Names         |  Raw Size | Estimated Transfer Size
main.827c007ab87203ca.js      | main          | 197.01 kB |                53.68 kB
polyfills.dad347e3b7b59f8b.js | polyfills     |  33.07 kB |                10.68 kB
runtime.b675cf46d6f899ec.js   | runtime       | 904 bytes |               515 bytes
styles.ef46db3751d8e999.css   | styles        |   0 bytes |                       -

                              | Initial Total | 230.96 kB |                64.87 kB
```
after only adding `SECURITY_CONTEXT`
```
Initial Chunk Files           | Names         |  Raw Size | Estimated Transfer Size
main.cbb87a39ee012458.js      | main          | 235.87 kB |                64.63 kB
polyfills.dad347e3b7b59f8b.js | polyfills     |  33.07 kB |                10.68 kB
runtime.b675cf46d6f899ec.js   | runtime       | 904 bytes |               515 bytes
styles.ef46db3751d8e999.css   | styles        |   0 bytes |                       -

                              | Initial Total | 269.82 kB |                75.81 kB
```


### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular CLI: 15.0.5
Node: 16.18.1
Package Manager: npm 8.19.2
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 15.1.4
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1501.5
@angular-devkit/build-angular   15.1.5
@angular-devkit/core            15.1.5
@angular-devkit/schematics      15.0.5
@angular/cli                    15.0.5
@schematics/angular             15.0.5
rxjs                            7.5.7
typescript                      4.8.4
```


### Anything else?

this maybe related to how the library is exporting the injection token, if this is the case please provide documentation of how to properly export from a library in a tree shakable way, because right now it's vague for library authors

Issues.Title: perf(@angular-devkit/build-angular): reduce rebuilt times when using the `scripts` option
Issues.Body:
In some cases, using the `scripts` option caused a lot of `DescriptionFileUtils.loadDescriptionFile` calls which caused a bottleneck during build times.

The why to this is still unknown, but a workaround is to use the resolver from the Webpack compilation instead of the compiler.

Closes #24634

---

From @fearghalom
> On rebuilds, it knocked ~35secs off the time.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "perf(@angular-devkit/build-angular): reduce rebuilt times when using the `scripts` option" (#24715)

Issues.Title: Unable to build monaco-editor(> v0.30.0) with Angular v15.x via custom webpack config
Issues.Body:
### Command

build

### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

v13.x

### Description

Unable to build an Angular project which is using Monaco Editor internally, via custom webpack configuration, as in `ng build` is not working for the project after migrating from Angular `13.x` to `15.x`.

### Minimal Reproduction

## Minimal Reproduction
- Install `v0.35.0` of `monaco-editor` in Angular `15` project.
- Install `monaco-editor-webpack-plugin`.
- Install `@angular-builders/custom-webpack`.
- Add a custom webpack configuration file:
```
const MonacoWebpackPlugin = require('monaco-editor-webpack-plugin');
const path = require("path");
const MiniCssExtractPlugin = require('mini-css-extract-plugin');

module.exports = {
    entry: {
        polyfills: './src/polyfills.ts',
        main: './src/main.ts'
    },
    output: {
        path: path.resolve(__dirname, 'dist'),
        filename: "js/[name].[contenthash].js",
        chunkFilename: 'chunks/[name].[chunkhash].js',
        assetModuleFilename: 'media/[name][hash][ext][query]'
    },
    module: {
        rules: [
            {
                test: /\.css$/,
                use: [
                    MiniCssExtractPlugin.loader,
                    "css-loader",
                    {
                        options: {
                            url: false
                        }
                    }
                ]
            }
        ]
    },
    plugins: [
        new MonacoWebpackPlugin({
            languages: ["typescript", "javascript", "css"]
        })
    ]
};
```
- Do necessary changes in `angular.json`:
```
"architect": {
  "build": {
    "builder": "@angular-builders/custom-webpack:browser",
      "options": {
        "customWebpackConfig": {
        "path": "./webpack.config.js",
        "mergeRules": {
          "externals": "replace"
        }
      },
    :
    :
    :
  }
}
```
- Try `ng build`.

### Exception or Error

Issues.Title: Unable to build monaco-editor(> v0.30.0) with Angular v15.x via custom webpack config
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

platform-browser

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

Unable to build an Angular project which is using Monaco Editor internally, via custom webpack configuration, as in `ng build` is not working for the project after migrating from Angular `13.x` to `15.x`.

## Minimal Reproduction
- Install `v0.35.0` of `monaco-editor` in Angular `15` project.
- Install `monaco-editor-webpack-plugin`.
- Install `@angular-builders/custom-webpack`.
- Add a custom webpack configuration file:
```
const MonacoWebpackPlugin = require('monaco-editor-webpack-plugin');
const path = require("path");
const MiniCssExtractPlugin = require('mini-css-extract-plugin');

module.exports = {
    entry: {
        polyfills: './src/polyfills.ts',
        main: './src/main.ts'
    },
    output: {
        path: path.resolve(__dirname, 'dist'),
        filename: "js/[name].[contenthash].js",
        chunkFilename: 'chunks/[name].[chunkhash].js',
        assetModuleFilename: 'media/[name][hash][ext][query]'
    },
    module: {
        rules: [
            {
                test: /\.css$/,
                use: [
                    MiniCssExtractPlugin.loader,
                    "css-loader",
                    {
                        options: {
                            url: false
                        }
                    }
                ]
            }
        ]
    },
    plugins: [
        new MonacoWebpackPlugin({
            languages: ["typescript", "javascript", "css"]
        })
    ]
};
```
- Do necessary changes in `angular.json`:
```
"architect": {
  "build": {
    "builder": "@angular-builders/custom-webpack:browser",
      "options": {
        "customWebpackConfig": {
        "path": "./webpack.config.js",
        "mergeRules": {
          "externals": "replace"
        }
      },
    :
    :
    :
  }
}
```
- Try `ng build`.

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

NA

Issues.Title: bug(mat-table): Non scoped style customizations behave differently from Scoped style customizations (css precedence conflict)
Issues.Body: ### Is this a regression? - [x] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version ### The previous version in which this bug was not present was Angular / Material 14 ### Description There is a CSS precedence conflict for mat-table where the height of mat-row is not set to 52px (as per spec) **unless** [scoped sass styles](https://material.angular.io/guide/theming#scoping-style-customizations) are used. This appears to be only in the 'flex' mat-table approach and not when using a native ``. ### Reproduction Steps to reproduce: - Create a mat-table without scoped CSS styles => row height is not 52px - Must use the 'flex' table approach and not native tables with directives ### Expected Behavior See this line from the [v15 migration docs](https://stackblitz.com/run?file=src%2Fapp%2Ftable-flex-basic-example.ts) under the `Table` component: Row height is 52px instead of 48px. That is the desired behavior for a table row per spec. ### Actual Behavior #### Example from Angular docs (no scoped styles) If you look at this stackblitz example from the docs [Basic use of `` (uses display flex)](https://material.angular.io/components/table/examples#table-basic) you will see an example which does not use [Scoped style customizations](https://material.angular.io/guide/theming#scoping-style-customizations). That particular example defines the mat styling (no wrapping selector) like this: @include mat.all-component-themes($theme); This mixin does indeed generate a `height:52px` selector as per spec, but it is overridden by a higher precedence selector - resulting in `height: unset`. The rows just end up at their 'natural' height. You can see that in this devtools screenshot. The higher precedence style appears to be coming from the [embedded scss styles in the Angular matTable component itself.](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/main/src/material/table/table.scss) #### Forked version with scoped styles Next I tried creating a [fork with scoped styles](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ohqraz-kxbm3v?file=src%2Ftheme.scss,src%2Findex.html) for the stackblitz page (which is how my own application is configured). .my-styles { @include mat.all-component-themes($theme); } Now the scoped selector has a higher precedence resulting in a row height of 52px as per spec. So **without** scoped styles (as in the example stackblitz) the behavior is not to spec. #### Another mat-table example in the docs Another example on the same page [Flex table where one column's cells has a greater height than others](https://material.angular.io/components/table/examples#table-flex-large-row) suggests using the following css to set the height of a column (the 'name' column). ``` .mat-column-name { height: 100px; } ``` That works in the stackblitz, but as soon as you add scoped styles it fails spectacularly because the cells are of height 100px and the containing row is of height 52px! ### Summary For my own needs I actually **want** the unset behavior, with perhaps a min-height because my rows need to grow with their content. I can figure out a workaround for now. I wanted to raise this since I can't find any other issues mentioning it and the current examples are not to spec since they don't use scoped styles. Note: I've only observed this with mat-table-row heights (I only updated to v15 yesterday), but it is potentially a wider issue. ### Environment - Angular: 15.0.0 / 15.1.4 - CDK/Material: 15.1.4 - Browser(s): Any - Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Any
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(mat-table): Non scoped style customizations behave differently from Scoped style customizations (css precedence conflict)" (#26628)

Issues.Title: cdk-virtual-scroll-viewport not working on iOS 15.3 and below Angular 14
Issues.Body:
### What are you trying to do?

Description

After upgrading my Angular application from version 13 to 14, I have noticed that the cdk-virtual-scroll-viewport component no longer works on iOS devices running version 15.3 or earlier. The virtual scrolling feature is not functioning correctly, and the scrolledIndexChange event is not updating as expected. Additionally, the scrollToIndex function is not working on iOS 15.3 or earlier when using Angular 14, although it worked when using Angular 13.

### What troubleshooting steps have you tried?

I have already attempted to update the @angular/cdk package to the latest version, but the issue persists. I have also checked the documentation and issue tracker for the cdk-virtual-scroll component, but could not find any known issues or workarounds specifically related to iOS 15.3 or earlier. Any assistance with resolving this issue would be greatly appreciated.

 I also tried downgrading my angular version to 13 and the cdk-virtual-scroll issue disappeared but I really need angular 14

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce

To reproduce the issue:

Create an Angular application with version 14. Implement the cdk-virtual-scroll-viewport component in the application. Test the application on an iOS device running version 15.3 or earlier. Observe that the virtual scrolling functionality is not working correctly, and the scrolledIndexChange event is not updating as expected. Expected behavior

The cdk-virtual-scroll-viewport component should allow for virtual scrolling on all devices, including iOS devices running version 15.3 or earlier. The scrolledIndexChange event should update correctly as the user scrolls, and the scrollToIndex function should work as expected

### Environment

- Angular: 14
- CDK/Material: 14.2.7
- Browser(s): Safari,
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "cdk-virtual-scroll-viewport not working on iOS 15.3 and below Angular 14" (#26623)

Issues.Title: select and de-select all options in mat-select dropdown
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description There should be a built in feature to in select dropdown in angular material to select and deselect all option in dropdown. Currently we have to custom code this feature using mat-select-trigger like below code. ### Use Case There are numerous example where this feature is needed. This is quite a general feature which is needed most of the time in case of multiple selection. For example like below code, we can have multiple boarding option for user accounts app for admin, if he want to select all option, he needed to select all one by one, base on which our api is called. If some cases option are so much that its hard and time consuming to select or deselect all of them. Currently there a lot of extra line of code need to be implemented to have this feature, and in some sites there can be lot of dropdowns especially in CMS sites. Built in feature for this save a lot of extra effort for this. All {{selectedOnboardingStates[0] ? selectedOnboardingStates[0].name : ''}} (+{{selectedOnboardingStates.length - 1}} {{selectedOnboardingStates.length === 2 ? 'other' : 'others'}})
Select All
{{item.name}}

Issues.Title: bug(theme): applying density "mat.all-component-densities(-3);" and "mat.chips-density(-3)" crashes compilation
Issues.Body:
### Description

In version 15 Angular Material Components, it is not possible to apply density globally for values lower than -2. Based on the error, the chips generate this crash. 

The Sass compilation crashes when adding any of the following two lines:
- `@include mat.chips-density(-3)`
- `@include mat.all-component-densities(-3)`


### Reproduction

 Use material theming as described in https://material.angular.io/guide/theming and apply density to all components with `-3` or lower values.

I created an application to check how densities affect the Angular Material Components. 
**Source code:** https://github.com/CrlsMrls/angular-material-component-densities
**Application running at:** https://angular-material-density.netlify.app/ 

This repository currently uses the latest version 15.1.4 (I will try to keep it updated).

Steps to reproduce:
1. `git clone https://github.com/CrlsMrls/angular-material-component-densities.git`
2. `cd angular-material-component-densities && npm install`
3. `npx ng serve` 
4. Open your browser on http://localhost:4200/ -> application works as expected
5. Change file `./src/styles.scss` line 34 from `@include mat.all-component-densities(0);` to `@include mat.all-component-densities(-3);` -> **application crashes**



### Expected Behavior

Application does not crash when applying lower density values to chips or to all components.

### Actual Behavior

Any of those settings generates the following error: 

```bash
./src/styles.scss - Error: Module build failed (from ./node_modules/sass-loader/dist/cjs.js):
SassError: "mdc-density: height must be between 24px and 32px (inclusive), but received 20px."
    â•·
632 â”‚     $height: density.prop-value(
    â”‚ â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€^
633 â”‚ â”‚     $density-config: $density-config,
634 â”‚ â”‚     $density-scale: $density-scale,
635 â”‚ â”‚     $property-name: height,
636 â”‚ â”‚   );
    â”‚ â””â”€â”€â”€^
    â•µ
  @material/chips/_chip-theme.scss 632:12                      density()
  node_modules/@angular/material/chips/_chips-theme.scss 97:5  density()
  src/styles.scss 42:3                                         root stylesheet
```

And application does not work.

### Environment

Angular: 15.1.4
CDK/Material: 15.1.4
Browser(s): Chrome Version 110.0.5481.77 (Official Build) (arm64) and Safari Version 16.2
Operating System: macOS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(theme): applying density "mat.all-component-densities(-3);" and "mat.chips-density(-3)" crashes compilation" (#26613)

Issues.Title: feat(cdk/scrolling): improve template type checking for CdkVirtualForOf Directive
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description ### Feature Description The CdkVirtualForOf Directive in the "@angular/cdk/scrolling" module does not implement the ng-template context guard, as it is done at the *ngFor Structual Directive in the Angular Common package. Thus, when using the *cdkVirtualFor Structual Directive in an HTML Template, the type of the item is "any". Expample: ```
{{ item }}
 ``` Although the type of the property "items" is "string[]", the type of "item" is "any". ### Expected behavior The type of the property "item" should be "string" when the type of "items" is "string[]". ### Suggested solution Implement the static method "ngTemplateContextGuard" for the CdkVirtualForOf Directive. ``` public static ngTemplateContextGuard( directive: CdkVirtualForOf, context: unknown, ): context is CdkVirtualForOfContext { return true; } ``` https://angular.io/guide/structural-directives#typing-the-directives-context If you want, I can create a PR therefore, because I tried this solution already. ### Use Case _No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat(cdk/scrolling): improve template type checking for CdkVirtualForOf Directive" (#26609)

Issues.Title: fix(cdk/dialog): not emitting closed event on external detachments
Issues.Body:
Fixes that the CDK dialog wasn't emitting to the `closed` event when it is detached externally, e.g. by a scroll strategy or a navigation. We had unit tests for this on the Material side, but we had special logic to handle it there.

Fixes #26581.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(cdk/dialog): not emitting closed event on external detachments" (#26608)
